alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Canyon; Custer; Fallon; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Northern Carbon; Southeastern Carbon; Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 24 at 1:14PM MDT until October 25 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, a wintry mix is expected. Total snow accumulations up to 3 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 7 inches possible. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southeast Montana. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 AM to 6 PM MDT Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday evening through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes. The weight of snow on tree limbs may down power lines and could cause sporadic power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A wintry mix of rain, freezing rain, and snow is expected to begin early Wednesday morning and persist into Wednesday afternoon. The potential for moderate to heavy snow develops by Wednesday evening through Thursday evening.
info.instruction: For the latest road conditions, call 5 1 1. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Persons should consider delaying travel Wednesday night through Friday morning. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.
